task.title: Creating a new meeting
task.shortdesc: The creating a new room option allows users to create a new meeting room in the task pane.

step.cmd: Type a unique name in the Name field.

choices.choice: Select Collaboration if the meeting is open to anyone that is provided with the meeting link.

Select Confidential if the meeting is restricted to a designated set of participants. You expect all participants to use credentials to access the meeting. If guest access is allowed, you must have waiting room enabled.
Select Lecture if the meeting participants are to be in listen-only mode. This choice is suited for presentations type meetings.

step.cmd: Select meeting settings. Settings vary based on the meeting mode that you selected.

plentry.pd: When enabled, anyone with the meeting details can join.
When enabled, a password is required for the meeting. Define the meeting password in the text box. Passwords must be at least eight characters.

This is a required setting for confidential-mode meetings.
Meeting password requires all participants, including moderators and owners, to enter a password to join the meeting.
Enable to place participants into a waiting room until you let them into the meeting.
Click Members can bypass to allow for meeting members not to be placed into the waiting and directly enter the meeting.

step.cmd: Manage meeting participants access and more in the Member access section

plentry.pd: When enabled, guests or people outside of the organization can join the meeting.
The Manage access feature allows you to add moderators to the meeting.
This setting determines who can start the meeting. If enabled, only moderators can start the meeting and control participant features such as who can present during the meeting.
This setting enables the meeting hosts to restrict who has access to the meeting.

step.cmd: Click Add to event to add the meeting to the Outlook event.
